meanings.sent1: Our club will need to recharter next year to continue our activities.
meanings.sent2: The organization decided to recharter their lease for another five years.
meanings.sent3: After forgetting to renew, they had to recharter their boat at the last minute.
meanings.sent4: The town council voted to recharter the local bus service, ensuring its continued operation.
meanings.sent5: She quickly realized she needed to recharter the venue for the event before it was too late.

meanings.definition: The act of renewing or extending a charter.
meanings.sent1: The rechartering of the company's license was a lengthy process.
meanings.sent2: We celebrated the successful rechartering of our organization with a party.
meanings.sent3: The rechartering of the library membership brought new benefits to the users.
meanings.sent4: The rechartering of the school's accreditation was a significant achievement.
meanings.sent5: The rechartering of the club's status as a non-profit organization was a relief to its members.
